definition: Wang Dan (1969-), Chinese dissident, one of the leaders of the Beijing student democracy movement of 1989
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great

sentences.english: He receives 700 yuan (US$86) from his family each month.
sentences.chinese: 王丹父母每月給他700元生活費。

sentences.english: I am permitted to have Miss Wang Dan in Beijing Library as my reference.
sentences.chinese: 我還被允許讓北京圖書館王丹女士作爲我的推薦人。

sentences.english: Bass player Wangdan, he always keep sedate and independent on living life and same on music.
sentences.chinese: 貝斯手王丹在生活和音樂中都會保持一份沉穩和獨立。

sentences.english: Wang Dan is my true friend .

definition: Wayne Wang (1949-), Chinese US film director
Zhang Yi (1608-1695), prolific author and poet spanning interregnum between Ming and Qing
edge of a tortoiseshell/see 冉冉[ran3 ran3]
Li Peng (1928-), leading PRC politician, prime minister 1987-1998, reportedly leader of the conservative faction advocating the June 1989 Tiananmen clampdown
surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
surname Di/variant of 狄[Di2], generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
